sounds like a real freeze. can be virtually anything. try booting in safe mode (or similar)
you could boot in single user mode (ask others for how to) and examine /var/log/Xorg.0.log (single user for not booting X again)
you could even try to get SSH up for the next normal boot and login from outside. sshd still works often, when you think the box is frozen.
try recovery mode. if it comes up, install the ssh server, so you can login next time the machine freezes
freezes - in many cases i still could log in, when the box seemed to be dead
you will need to install it first... sudo apt-get install sshd

yes. its remote shell access (like the terminal but over ip) - in case your x freezes, you often still can connect from outside and investigate. thats why i recommended it
